onset.Description: Marks the start of an ongoing event of temporal extent.

duration.LongName: The period of time during which an event occurs. Refers to Image duration or response time after stimulus depending on event_type
duration.Description: a. For falsebelief and falsephoto trial types, duration refers to the image presentations of falsebelief and falsephoto stories. b. For rating_falsebelief and rating_falsephoto, duration refers to the response time to answer true false questions, followed by falsebelief or flasephoto stimulu

event_type.Description: Categorical variable of event types within run

Levels.dummy: Study phase items, but intended to be excluded from analysis due to primacy or recency effects. These items are presented in the first three or last three orders
Levels.study: Study phase items: Participants are shown items (e.g., images) to memorize for subsequent testing. This phase aims to encode the items into participants' memory.
Levels.test: Test phase items: Participants are asked to identify previously studied items ('old') and distinguish them from new, unstudied items ('new'), assessing recall and recognition abilities.
Levels.distraction_math: Simple math problems are presented to participants, serving to temporarily divert attention from the study-test sequence. This task is designed to mitigate rehearsal and reduce potential carry-over effects between the study and test phases.

value.LongName: The levels of study items and test items

Levels.study_dummy: Presentation of items to study - the first and the last three items are discarded due to primary/recency effects, indicated as dummy.
Levels.test_old: Test phase items: items that were presented during study phase
Levels.test_new: Test phase items: items that were not presented during study phase; new items presented to participant during test phase
Levels.math: Simple math problems presented during math phase

response_accuracy.Description: Correct or Incorrect response in regards to question presented on screen; Options are Old and New, presented on screen, underneath image. Participants are promted to respond with MR-compatible button box

Levels.correct: Correct response in regards to image (correctly identified as old or new)
Levels.incorrect: Incorrect response in regards to image (incorrectly identified as old or new)

stim_file.LongName: Stimulus filename which is presented on screen
stim_file.Description: Given text file encompasses test that is displayed on screen. Filename is designated as {digit}{belief_or_photo}_{story_or_question}.txt. Digit indicates the number of stimulus that was presented. b or p indicates whether stimulus was false belief or false photo event. Story or question indicates which event was presented on screen.

button_press.Description: Given text file encompasses test that is displayed on screen. Filename is designated as {digit}{belief_or_photo}_{story_or_question}.txt. Digit indicates the number of stimulus that was presented. b or p indicates whether stimulus was false belief or false photo event. Story or question indicates which event was presented on screen.

Levels.old: Participant presses old button to indicate they saw the item during the study phase. Old option is presented on the left side of the screen
Levels.new: Participant presses new button to indicate they did not see the item during the study phase. New option is presented on the right side of the screen

reaction_time.LongName: Reaction time of responding to test item
reaction_time.Description: Reaction time is measure as the time of button press minus the time of test item presentation
